rule: The "Specific topics:" section must only include topics that can be concretely identified from the text, avoiding overly general or unrelated topics.
input: Text: Renewable energy and electric vehicles were key topics discussed by Tesla at the forum.
validityText:
The input is a block of text that mentions "Renewable energy" and "electric vehicles" as topics, and also provides the context that these were discussed by a company, "Tesla", at a forum. This text is in a human-readable format and an understandable language, thus satisfying the requirement for the input to be in such a format. The text contains a complete statement that includes relevant entities: the name of a company (Tesla), specific topics (renewable energy and electric vehicles), and an activity (discussion at a forum). There is no specific length constraint in the input specification, so the length of this text is not an issue. The text does not violate any of the conditions set forth in the input specification, as it encompasses names of companies, possible themes, and topics related to the content in a coherent and complete manner.

No violation.
OK
coverageText:
Company names: Tesla  
People names:  
Specific topics: Renewable energy, Electric vehicles  
General themes: Sustainability, Environmental innovation
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output provides a response in the desired format by listing variables under clear headings: Company names, People names, Specific topics, and General themes, as specified in the description. Each category is mentioned even if it has no content (e.g., People names is empty), which complies with formatting requirements. Based on the provided output, there is no violation of the described format; each category is appropriately represented.

No violation.
OK
